reviews.review_msg: Ironically, I did better in this course when I was bored than the last course with her than I got into.  But I also think she was more focused and impartial in her teaching here than when I did her course on free will.  She seemed to have here own axe to grind in that course...not so much with this one.

Pros: She's very knowledgeable prof, and never failed to keep me interested.
 Cons: Very strange marking system.  She took a blessed amount of time to get us back our assignments, and had a very odd system of marking.  I'll never understand how I can get an A- and hardly receive ANY comments.
Her Nietzsche course was the best I've ever taken (and probably ever will) at SFU. She's a fairly tough marker, but fair nonetheless and offers useful criticism. TAKE THIS COURSE!
Her Nietzsche course was one of the best courses that I've ever taken.

I'm not sure if I have the course # right, but I took her NIetzsche course.  It was fabulous.  One of the best courses that I've ever taken.  It's not easy, but it's also not really hard.  Just right, I'd say.  The lectures were interesting and fun.
great prof, knows his stuff. I would take a class with him again. Cute too!
My advice to you:  go to his office hours and chat.

As insane as this course was, being METAMETAmetaphysics course, this prof was amazing at teaching this complicated (and at times overwhelming) material.  He's a really helpful, patient guy, and just committed to helping you understand the course and do well.  Great informative and sometimes amusing lecturer. Would defs take another course with him.

Took a 300 level selected topics class with her on the philosophy of biology couple years ago. Demonstrates a genuine passion for philosophy. Fairly clear in her explanations and the syllabus was woven together in a progressive manner culminating in several contemporary discussions in the philosophy of evolutionary theory. Tough grader though.

I felt that Jillian did a fantastic job conducting a class on Phil of Sport although it was her first time. Undoubtedly, Jillian was a hard marker; however, she was also a fair marker who was willing to help her students understand course material. If you'd really like to benefit from taking a course with Jillian, be prepared give it your best.
